intro: Arracacia tolucensis var. tolucensis, commonly known as the Tolucensis arracacha, is a perennial herb native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are valued for their culinary and medicinal properties, often used in traditional Andean cuisine. This variety is distinguished by its robust growth and adaptability to high-altitude environments.
